channel.title: EPA in Georgia
channel.description: Updated EPA in Georgia content from the US Environmental Protection Agency

item.title: EPA Region 4 Rain Catcher Awards
item.description:
USEPA Southeast Region announces the fourth annual Rain Catcher Awards for excellence in implementation of stormwater green infrastructure (GI) projects. Nominations will be accepted in four categories: Municipal, Commercial, Tribal, and Neighborhood/Community levels. Winners will be announced and presented with awards at the fourth annual joint International Erosion Control Association Region 1 and EPA Region 4 Municipal Wet Weather Stormwater Conference in Charleston, SC on May 17, 2017. Winners will be notified no later than April 14, 2017, and will be encouraged to attend the Conference. Criteria for consideration are explained below.

  • 2017 EPA Region 4 Rain Catcher Awards (PDF)(6 pp, 262 K)
item.dc:creator: smaddox

item.title: Region 4 Superfund Annual Report FY2016: Reaching for the Next Level of Public Health and Environmental Protection
item.description:
Learn more about the region 4 superfund program program in action, protecting public health and advancing environmental protection.

  • Region 4 Superfund Annual Report 2016 (PDF)(44 pp, 4 MB)
item.dc:creator: smaddox

item.title: Accreditations and Lab Certifications for the Science and Ecosystem Support Division in the Southeast
item.description:
1. The Drinking Water Certificate, issued to the SESD Analytical Services Branch Laboratory, for the analysis of drinking waters samples.
  1. The ISO/IEC 17025 and Forensic Testing Accreditation Certificate and Scope for the SESD’s Laboratory and Field Operations.
  • SESD Drinking Water Certification Memo (PDF)(3 pp, 933 K)
  • SESD ISO/IEC 17025 and Forensic Accreditation Certificate and Scope (PDF)(3 pp, 372 K)

item.title: Environmental Information for Georgia
item.description:
• Air
  • Water
  • Land and Waste Cleanups
  • Pesticides and Other Toxic Chemicals
  • Real-time map of today's air quality forecast in Georgia on AirNow.gov
  • MyAir. MyAir shows many different kinds of air data for Georgia.
  • MyClimate. MyClimate shows greenhouse gas emissions by sector, and other kinds of climate data, for Georgia.
  • Clean Air Act permitting in Georgia
  • Fact sheet on the Clean Power Plan for Georgia (2 pp, 238 K, About PDF)
  • Real-time radiation data from monitors located in Georgia:
    • Atlanta
    • Augusta
  • State Implementation Plans (SIPs) for air quality approved by EPA for Georgia
  • Air compliance dashboard: see trends in environmental compliance and enforcement. The dashboard provides an easy-to-use summary of activities to answer questions like: which facilities are regulated, how many have been inspected or otherwise evaluated, and how many have alleged violations and have been subject to enforcement.
  • MyWater. MyWater shows many different kinds of water data for Georgia.
  • Protecting Your Well and Wellhead PDF (2 pp, yy K, About PDF) Exit
  • Water quality standards
  • Region 4 actions to address climate change impacts on water
  • Managing ocean dumping off of Region 4's coasts
  • Climate-Ready Estuaries projects in Region 4
  • Underground injection control program in Region 4
  • Compliance dashboards: see trends in environmental compliance and enforcement. The dashboards provide an easy-to-use summary of activities to answer questions like: which facilities are regulated, how many have been inspected or otherwise evaluated, and how many have alleged violations and have been subject to enforcement.
    • Drinking water dashboard
    • U.S. waters dashboard
  • List of all cleanups
  • Map of all cleanups
  • List of Superfund sites
  • Brownfields and land revitalization in Region 4
  • Hazardous waste compliance dashboard: see trends in environmental compliance and enforcement. The dashboard provides an easy-to-use summary of activities to answer questions like: which facilities are regulated, how many have been inspected or otherwise evaluated, and how many have alleged violations and have been subject to enforcement.
  • Agency in Georgia that regulates pesticides Exit
  • Most recent fact sheet on the management of certain toxic chemicals in Georgia from EPA's Toxic Release Inventory
    • Go to approved SIPs in Region 4
  • Pesticides compliance dashboard: see trends in environmental compliance and enforcement. The dashboard provides an easy-to-use summary of activities to answer questions like: which facilities are regulated, how many have been inspected or otherwise evaluated, and how many have alleged violations and have been subject to enforcement.
item.dc:creator: smaddox

item.title: List of Superfund Sites in Georgia
item.description:
Related Information

  • View a community guide to EPA's Superfund program (PDF)(2 pp, 454KB)
  • Learn more about...
    • The Superfund cleanup process
    • Deleting sites from the National Priorities List
  • Frequent questions about Superfund

Below is a list that shows:

  • proposed, final and deleted sites on the National Priorities ListNational Priorities ListEPA's list of the most serious uncontrolled or abandoned hazardous waste sites identified for possible long-term remedial action under Superfund. The list is based primarily on the score a site receives from the Hazard Ranking System. (NPL)
  • non-NPL sites subject to Superfund alternative approach (SAA) agreements.

item.title: Contact Us about EPA in Georgia
item.description:
Report a Violation

Report possible violations of environmental laws and regulations.

Please use the form below to send us comments or questions. Be sure to include your e-mail address if you’d like a response.

Mailing Address:

United States Environmental Protection Agency
Region 4
Sam Nunn Atlanta Federal Center
61 Forsyth Street, SW 
Atlanta, GA 30303-8960

Main: (404) 562-9900
Toll Free: 1-800-241-1754
Fax: (404) 562-8174
